meta.@content: Camera, CameraShot and CameraMove examples that demonstrate storyboard capabilities and precise camera operation. This is a developmental effort for potential X3D Specification improvement.

Two demos are found in the scene, click the "red text" on left or right to start. (a) SimpleShotsTest shows Zoom in/out, Pan left/right, Boom up/down, Tilt left/right, with each is defined by a CameraShot collecting a series of CameraMovements. (b) AimPointTest gradually slews the camera view to look at the sliding cube, then follows it around before returning to original viewpoint.
Schematron rules, backed up by initialize() checks
Camera nodes for Viewpoint navigation control

ExternProtoDeclare.@appinfo: Camera node provides direct control of scene view to enable cinematic camera animation shot by shot and move by move along with still digital-photography settings for offline rendering of camera images

field.@appinfo: Text description to be displayed for this Camera
Camera position in local transformation frame, which is default prior to first CameraShot initialPosition getting activated
Camera rotation in local transformation frame, which is default prior to first CameraShot initialPosition getting activated
pi/4
input fraction drives interpolators
input event binds or unbinds this Camera
output event indicates when this Camera is bound
output event indicates whether this Camera is bound or unbound
Vector distance to near clipping plane corresponds to NavigationInfo.avatarSize[0]
Vector distance to far clipping plane corresponds to NavigationInfo.visibilityLimit
Array of CameraShot nodes which in turn contain CameraMovement nodes
Whether camera headlight is on or off
Camera headlight color
Camera headlight intensity
Camera filter color that modifies virtual lens capture
Camera filter transparency that modifies virtual lens capture
upVector changes modify camera orientation (and possibly vice versa)
Focal length divided effective aperture diameter indicating width of focal plane
Distance to focal plane of sharpest focus
Mark start/stop with true/false output respectively useful to trigger external animations
Total duration of contained enabled CameraShot (and thus CameraMovement) move durations
OfflineRender node
enable console output to trace script computations and prototype progress

-children.#comment: Viewpoint-related fields, NavigationInfo-related fields and Camera-unique fields

ExternProtoDeclare.@appinfo: OfflineRender defines a parameters for offline rendering of Camera animation output to a movie file (or possibly a still shot)

Render operation complete
Format of rendered output movie (mpeg mp4 etc.), use first supported format
Format of rendered output images (png jpeg gif tiff etc.) use first supported format

ExternProtoDeclare.@appinfo: CrossHair prototype provides a heads-up display (HUD) crosshair at the view center, which is useful for assessing NavigationInfo lookAt point

field.@appinfo: whether CrissHair orititype is enabled or not
control whether enabled/disabled
color of CrossHair marker
size of CrossHair in meters
distance in front of HUD viewpoint

-children.#comment: turn on CrossHairInstance when animated camera viewpoints are bound

turn off CrossHairInstance when animated camera viewpoints are unbound <BooleanFilter DEF='NegateCrossHair'/> <ROUTE fromField='isBound' fromNode='Camera.SimpleShotsTest' toField='set_boolean' toNode='NegateCrossHair'/> <ROUTE fromField='isBound' fromNode='Camera.AimPointTest' toField='set_boolean' toNode='NegateCrossHair'/> <ROUTE fromField='inputNegate' fromNode='NegateCrossHair' toField='set_enabled' toNode='CrossHairInstance'/>
